intro: Pilea ophioderma, commonly known as the silver mitten plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, silver-green leaves that have a velvety texture. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters during the growing season. Pilea ophioderma is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
